description: image of a man's face in stark contrast; left side of his face is heavily shadowed and the right side is brightly lit
portfolio: From Friends of the Artist: A Suite of Seven Etchings and Lithographs
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn. (until d. 2012); by descent to his daughter Catherine Andrus, Minneapolis; given to MIA, 2018.
text: Draftsman, painter, and printmaker Michael Mazur (1935–2009) whose work encompassed studies of inmates in the locked ward of an insane asylum, lyrical landscapes, Dante's Inferno, delicate flowers, and views of an ordinary backyard. This portrait is part of a portfolio of seven that Barbara Swan made of artist friends who worked in New England.
title: Michael Mazur
